page.title: 13Ponteland Village Schools
page.content: {Education}within the area is provided by Ponteland County{First School}for children from 4-9yrs.and Coates Endowed{Middle School}for those from 9-13yrs.The former provides education across the broad spectrum of the curriculum-from the 3Rs to science,art enviromental studies,and physical education-with each class having their own teacher and classroom.Many of the classes work an integrated type time- table with an emphasis on the practical side.At present(1985)there are six teachers each with their own class,a headmaster and 160 children. The{Middle School}has over 250 pupils with specialist teachers for science, French,Home Economics,Music,Physical Education,History,Geography,and Craft. Pupils are taught in special rooms for many of these subjects.The schools are linked by a large playing/games field.
